alert.note: Alert for Robeson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 12:44AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Robeson, northeastern Florence, western Dillon, northeastern Darlington and Marlboro Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 1243 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Cheraw State Park, or 10 miles southwest of Cheraw, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bennettsville, Maxton, Mccoll, Clio, Dovesville, Raemon, Mont Clare, Brownsville, Oak Grove, Wallace, Bingham, Mechanicsville, Chavistown, Dunbar, Minturn, Society Hill, Gibson, Blenheim and Tatum. This includes Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 174 and 185. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
